intro: Cupania saponarioides, commonly known as the soapberry tree, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, green berry that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its use in traditional medicine.
